title: Atul Subhash suicide case: Allahabad HC grants anticipatory bail to Nikita Singhania's uncle - The Times of India
GRAP-4 Restrictions Reimposed In Delhi As Air Quality Dips To 'Severe+' - NDTV
Parliament Winter Session: 'One Nation, One Poll' bill likely to be introduced in LS tomorrow - Hindustan Times
Nirbhaya's mother says ‘daughters still not safe’ 12 years after Delhi gangrape case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Nirbhaya's Mother Speaks Out on Women's Safety 12 Years After Gangrape Case

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Asha Devi, mother of the 2012 Delhi gangrape victim, expressed her grief and concern regarding women’s safety in India, stating that despite tougher laws, changes have not been realized in society.

  • Asha Devi highlighted the lack of safety for women in India even after 12 years since her daughter's tragedy.
  • She criticized the criminal justice system for its inefficiency in handling cases of violence against women.
  • During her emotional speech at the National Convention on Prevention of Violence Against Women and Children, she recounted her distress over the ongoing peril women face.
  • Devi mentioned a recent case of a doctor’s murder, underscoring the persistent issues of violence and inadequate investigation.
  • She called for a reevaluation of the approaches towards women's safety by government bodies.
“Even after 12 years, the circumstances have not changed. The daughters of the country are not safe.” - Asha Devi

The ongoing struggle for justice emphasizes the need for more robust societal changes to ensure women's safety, as articulated by Asha Devi, who continues to grapple with her daughter's loss while advocating for a safer future for all women.
newTitle: Nirbhaya's Mother Speaks Out on Women's Safety 12 Years After Gangrape Case

title: India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry - The Hindu
summary:
India, China Special Representatives to hold talks in Beijing on December 18: Chinese Foreign Ministry

Published on: December 16, 2024 09:45 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

The Special Representatives of India and China will meet in Beijing on December 18, 2024, to discuss restoring bilateral ties after a recent agreement to disengage troops in eastern Ladakh.

  • Director Wang Yi and NSA Ajit Doval will hold the 23rd meeting on the China-India Boundary Question.
  • The meeting follows a five-year gap since the last one in 2019.
  • Efforts aim to normalize relations strained since April 2020.
  • Trade remains the only area of cooperation amidst rising tensions.
“The two sides have reached resolutions on relevant matters, which China speaks highly of.” - Chinese Foreign Ministry

The upcoming talks are crucial for both nations to build upon recently agreed resolutions and enhance diplomatic relations.
newTitle: India and China to Discuss Border Issues in Beijing

title: KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race - NDTV
summary:
KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race

Date: March 26, 2024 | Source: NDTV

A corruption case has been filed against KT Rama Rao, the former minister of Telangana, over alleged irregularities linked to the 2023 Formula E race held in Hyderabad.

  • The Anti-Corruption Bureau alleges a transfer of ₹55 crore to the event organizers occurred on the verbal orders of Mr. Rao.
  • Former principal secretary Arvind Kumar admitted to transferring funds without cabinet approval and circumventing the Election Commission's permission.
  • The payment allegedly occurred in pounds without Reserve Bank of India clearance.
  • Mr. Rao claims he is being targeted by the current Congress government following a political shift.
  • The next Formula E scheduled for February 2024 was canceled after the Congress came to power.
“I am being targeted by the Congress government” - KT Rama Rao

The ongoing investigation raises questions about the accountability of political figures in financial matters and their oversight in public fund management.
newTitle: KTR Faces Corruption Case Over Alleged Irregularities In 2023 Formula E Race

title: 'Won't let anyone threaten India's security': Sri Lankan president's promise to PM Modi - Hindustan Times
summary:
Sri Lankan President's Commitment to India's Security During New Delhi Visit

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: HT News Desk

Sri Lankan President Anura Kumara Disanayaka has pledged during his visit to India that no force will be allowed to use Sri Lankan territory to threaten India's security, emphasizing strong defense cooperation between the nations.

  • The meeting between Disanayaka and Prime Minister Modi aims to strengthen ties amid growing concerns about China's influence in the region.
  • Disanayaka reiterated Sri Lanka's commitment to support India, fostering further cooperation.
  • India and Sri Lanka are planning new initiatives, including an electricity grid and a petroleum pipeline, to enhance economic relations.
  • The backdrop of the visit includes Sri Lanka's economic crisis and China's aggressive presence in the Indo-Pacific.
“The cooperation with India will certainly flourish and I want to reassure our continued support for India,” Disanayaka stated at a press briefing.

The visit is significant as it symbolizes the strengthening of India-Sri Lanka relations in light of regional security concerns, particularly regarding China's actions in the Indian Ocean.
newTitle: Sri Lankan President's Commitment to India's Security During New Delhi Visit

title: After Rahul vs Mamata leadership tussle, it is now EVM divide in opposition INDIA bloc - The Times of India
summary:
After Rahul vs Mamata leadership tussle, it is now EVM divide in opposition INDIA bloc

Publication Date: Unknown Source: Unknown

This article discusses the recent divide within the opposition INDIA bloc regarding Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) in the wake of leadership tensions between Rahul Gandhi and Mamata Banerjee.

  • The recent leadership tussle in the opposition highlighted tensions between key figures.
  • There is a growing divide concerning the trust in EVMs as a voting mechanism.
  • Concerns have been raised about election integrity impacting the opposition's unity.
"The tussle has raised questions about the future direction of the opposition coalition."

The current situation underscores deep-seated issues within the opposition, raising concerns for the upcoming electoral processes.
newTitle: EVM Divide in Opposition INDIA Bloc After Leadership Tussle

title: "Some Agencies Giving Manipulated Info To Centre": Manipur Chief Minister - NDTV
‘My father could not tolerate the uproar’: Son of official who died at BPSC exam centre in Patna amid ruckus - The Indian Express
summary:
‘My father could not tolerate the uproar’: Son of official who died at BPSC exam centre in Patna amid ruckus

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: The Indian Express

The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has ordered a re-examination for candidates who took the preliminary test at a Patna examination centre, where an official, Ram Iqbal Singh, died due to a heart attack amid disruptive protests from students.

  • Ram Iqbal Singh, a 58-year-old additional centre superintendent, suffered a heart attack during the chaos at the Bapu Pariksha Parisar centre.
  • Protests erupted over alleged delays in the distribution of question papers for the Combined Competitive Examination (CCE).
  • BPSC chairman announced the cancellation of the preliminary exam and plans for a re-test for approximately 6,500 candidates.
  • Police are investigating the matter and have already identified 30-40 students involved in the disruptions.
“My father had suffered a heart attack earlier as well. There had been so much tension and uproar at the centre, and my father could not tolerate it.” - Sunny Kumar, son of Ram Iqbal Singh

In the wake of the incident, calls for creating a calmer atmosphere during exams have been emphasized by the victim's family.
newTitle: Tragic Incident at BPSC Exam Centre in Patna Leads to Re-examination

title: Tempers fly after Mahayuti cabinet expansion. Left out, Bhujbal says 'reward for taking on Jarange Patil' - ThePrint
summary:
Mahayuti Cabinet Expansion Sparks Controversy Among Leaders

Date: Not specified Source: ThePrint

The Mahayuti government's recent cabinet expansion has resulted in backlash from key alliance figures, including NCP's Chhagan Bhujbal and Shiv Sena's Vijay Shivtare, following the exclusion of several senior leaders.

  • The cabinet expansion introduced 39 new ministers, including 19 from BJP and 11 from Shiv Sena.
  • Bhujbal expressed his disappointment at being dropped and rejected a Rajya Sabha nomination, indicating it caused a breach of trust.
  • Shivtare criticized the leadership for not keeping party members informed about the cabinet decisions.
  • Discontent among dropped leaders remains, despite claims from others that they accept the party’s decision.
“I am a common karyakarta, how does it matter if I am sidestepped or cast aside?” - Chhagan Bhujbal

The situation highlights the tensions within the Mahayuti coalition as it seeks to manage party dynamics ahead of upcoming elections.
newTitle: Mahayuti Cabinet Expansion Sparks Controversy Among Leaders

title: Heavy Rains Likely In Tamil Nadu As Low Pressure Area Expected To Form In Bay Of Bengal Today - News18
summary:
Heavy Rains Likely In Tamil Nadu As Low Pressure Area Expected To Form In Bay Of Bengal Today

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18 Tamil

The Indian Meteorological Department has issued an orange alert for very heavy rain in four districts of Tamil Nadu as a low-pressure area is expected to form in the Bay of Bengal.

  • An orange alert has been issued for Nagapattinam, Thiruvarur, Mayiladuthurai, and Cuddalore districts.
  • Heavy rain is also expected in Thanjavur, Ariyalur, Perambalur, Pudukkottai, Tiruchirappalli, Kallakurichi, Villupuram, Chengalpattu districts, and Puducherry.
  • Moderate rain is likely to continue in Tamil Nadu and Puducherry.
  • Fishermen are advised against venturing into the coastal areas due to expected gusts of wind up to 55 km/h.
The Meteorological Department has stated that the low-pressure area is likely to strengthen and move towards Tamil Nadu in a west-northwesterly direction.

This weather event is expected to have significant impacts on the region, especially considering the potential for widespread rainfall and advisories issued for safety.
newTitle: Heavy Rains Likely In Tamil Nadu With Orange Alert Issued

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Both houses adjourn for the day - The Hindu
Tamil Nadu Braces For Downpour, Heavy Rain Likely In Chennai This Week | Check IMD’s Forecast - News18
summary:
Heavy Rain Expected in Tamil Nadu and Chennai This Week

Last Updated: December 17, 2024, 01:32 IST | Source: News18

Tamil Nadu is set to witness another week of rain and thunderstorms as the India Meteorological Department (IMD) has forecast squally weather off South Tamil Nadu coast among other areas for the coming days.

  • The IMD has issued an orange alert for very heavy rain in four districts.
  • Heavy rainfall is expected due to a low-pressure area in the South Andaman Sea.
  • Maximum wind speeds of up to 55 km/h are predicted.
  • Temperatures in Chennai are forecasted to range from 23°C to 30°C.
  • The region has recorded a 32% surplus in rainfall since October 1.
“Isolated heavy to very heavy rainfall expected on 17th and 18th December.”

The IMD has advised fishermen to avoid coastal waters as hazardous conditions are anticipated.
newTitle: Heavy Rain Expected in Tamil Nadu and Chennai This Week

‘Muslims will become majority’: Trinamool condemns, distances itself from Minister Firhad Hakim’s remark - The Hindu
summary:
TMC Condemns Minister Hakim's Remarks on Muslim Majority

Date: December 16, 2024 Source: The Hindu

The Trinamool Congress (TMC) has distanced itself from Minister Firhad Hakim's controversial remarks about Muslims potentially becoming a majority in West Bengal.

  • The TMC strongly condemned Hakim's statement, asserting it does not reflect the party's position.
  • Hakim, a prominent minority leader, stated that Muslims would soon no longer be a minority community.
  • The party emphasized its commitment to peace and communal harmony, asserting there would be strict measures against remarks threatening social fabric.
“The All India Trinamool Congress firmly disassociates itself from and strongly condemns the statement made by Shri Firhad Hakim...” — All India Trinamool Congress (@AITCofficial)

The incident indicates a significant internal party response to Hakim's remarks, which have attracted criticism from opposition parties like the BJP.
newTitle: TMC Condemns Minister Hakim's Remarks on Muslim Majority

title: After Jairam's 'Electoral Loss' Admission In Rajya Sabha, Sitharaman Says 'Indira Gandhi Learnt Lesson' - News18
NSA Ajit Doval Likely To Visit China For Special Representative Talks: Sources - News18
Arvind Kejriwal claims Centre failed to ensure women's safety, BJP reminds AAP of Swati Maliwal case - Hindustan Times
summary:
Kejriwal Accuses Centre of Failing Women’s Safety, BJP Responds

Date: Dec 16, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Arvind Kejriwal, the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) national convener, criticized the BJP-led Centre for failing to ensure women's safety in Delhi. He emphasized that he treats women’s safety seriously and has taken various initiatives to improve it.

  • Kejriwal accused the BJP of neglecting women's safety while having control over Delhi police.
  • At a 'Mahila Adalat' event, he reaffirmed that he does not view women merely as a “vote bank.”
  • He claimed to have implemented measures like installing CCTV cameras and appointing bus marshals to enhance safety.
  • Women at the event shared their experiences of sexual assault, bringing attention to the ongoing issue.
  • The BJP countered by referencing a recent harassment complaint against a member of the AAP.
“Ten years ago, you gave me the responsibility to improve schools, hospitals, and water supply in Delhi, and I have done my work. But you gave the responsibility of security to BJP and Amit Shah, who has failed.”

The event was a poignant reminder of past tragedies and the continuing challenges faced by women. Kejriwal and other speakers emphasized the need for stronger commitments to women’s safety.
newTitle: Kejriwal Accuses Centre of Failing Women’s Safety, BJP Responds

title: Parliament Winter Session 2024 Day 17 LIVE updates: ‘Ambedkar opposed Art 370’, claims Hardeep Puri in Rajya Sabha - The Hindu
Why NSA Ajit Doval’s China Visit Is Key: Exclusive On December 18 Talks - News18
summary:
NSA Ajit Doval’s Upcoming China Visit: Key Talks on December 18

Date: December 16, 2024

Source: News18

National Security Advisor Ajit Doval is set to visit China for Special Representative (SR) talks on December 18, focusing on LAC disengagement amidst hope for meaningful dialogue to prevent incidents similar to Galwan.

  • The visit is part of ongoing negotiations following the eastern Ladakh military standoff that began in May 2020.
  • Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi will represent China during the talks.
  • The discussions aim to clarify the Line of Actual Control (LAC) and resolve operational issues to prevent further confrontations.
  • Expectations are hopeful for achieving significant progress and defining timelines for future meetings.
“We are hopeful to have meaningful dialogue with China for further engagement and to avoid a Galwan-like incident,” said government sources.

This visit could be crucial for stabilizing relations and defining clear operational boundaries in the ongoing India-China dialogue.
newTitle: NSA Ajit Doval’s Upcoming China Visit: Key Talks on December 18

title: ‘If you don’t know how to fight polls…': BJP to Rahul Gandhi after Omar Abdullah's jibe at INDIA ally Cong - Hindustan Times
summary:
BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Election Strategy After Omar Abdullah's Comments

Date: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has urged Rahul Gandhi to stop blaming electronic voting machines for the Congress party's electoral failures, emphasizing the need for a solid election strategy instead.

  • The BJP states that leadership qualities cannot be imposed and must be earned.
  • BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra termed the opposition INDIA bloc as a "scam'' due to its divided leadership.
  • Omar Abdullah emphasized that Congress needs to justify its leading role in the alliance.
  • Trinamool Congress MP Abhishek Banerjee spoke on the credibility of EVMs and challenged opposition members to prove their allegations.
  • Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis suggested Congress introspect instead of blaming EVMs for election losses.
“Leadership is not earned and not demanded. You have to have the qualities of a leader. You cannot impose yourself.” - Sambit Patra

The BJP's response highlights the ongoing tensions within the opposition alliance and calls into question the unity and effectiveness of its electoral strategies.
newTitle: BJP Criticizes Rahul Gandhi Over Election Strategy After Omar Abdullah's Comments

title: Parliament Winter Session Live: Nirmala Sitharaman begins Constitution debate - Hindustan Times
Parliament Winter Session Live: Cong MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra demands restoration of '71 war photo - Hindustan Times
summary:
Priyanka Gandhi Demands Restoration of 1971 War Photo in Parliament

Published on: Dec 16, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

During the Winter Session of Parliament, Congress MP Priyanka Gandhi Vadra called for the restoration of a photo depicting the surrender of the Pakistani army during the 1971 war.

  • The final week of the Winter Session began with discussions on various important topics.
  • Priyanka Gandhi highlighted the bravery of soldiers in the 1971 war.
  • Government's decision on introducing bills for simultaneous elections has been deferred.
  • The session also involved debates on other political issues, including farmers' protests and minority rights.
“I want to salute the brave soldiers who fought for us in the war of 1971.” - Priyanka Gandhi Vadra

Gandhi's comments stirred significant debate, emphasizing the importance of remembering historical events and acknowledging past sacrifices.
newTitle: Priyanka Gandhi Demands Restoration of 1971 War Photo in Parliament

title: Ustad Zakir Hussain Passes Away: His Last Public Appearance At Pankaj Udhas' Funeral Goes Viral | Watch - News18
‘Jai Shri Ram’ slogan inside mosque: How shouting particular religious phrase an offence, Supreme Court asks - The Hindu
summary:
Supreme Court Asks Karnataka to Respond on Shouting 'Jai Sriram' in Mosque Case

Date: December 16, 2024
Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court sought a response from Karnataka regarding the High Court's decision that shouting 'Jai Sriram' in a mosque does not outrage religious feelings.

  • The High Court previously quashed criminal proceedings against two individuals who shouted the slogan after trespassing into the Badriya Juma Masjid.
  • The Supreme Court is reviewing the High Court's rationale, which found the behavior not significant enough to provoke outrage.
  • The case will be heard again on January 17, 2025.
  • The petition argues that the High Court's decision may embolden anti-social behavior and violence against minorities.
“Such utterances... would give a fillip to anti-social elements to resort to such religious chants to justify gruesome crimes like mob lynching and targeted attacks upon the minorities across the country.”

The ongoing legal discourse highlights tensions surrounding religious expressions in India and concerns over communal harmony.
newTitle: Supreme Court Asks Karnataka to Respond on Shouting 'Jai Sriram' in Mosque Case

title: Parliament Winter Session Day 17 LIVE Updates: Caste census, Article 370 and 356 dominate Constitution debate in Rajya Sabha - The Hindu
RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024 - SarkariExam.com
summary:
RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024

Date: December 16, 2024 | Source: Rajasthan Agricultural University (RAU)

Rajasthan Agricultural University (RAU) has issued a notification for the recruitment of Compounder and Nurse for a total of 740 positions. The online application process commenced on December 16, 2024, and will remain open until January 15, 2025.

Key Details:

  • Notification Date: 12 December 2024
  • Application Start Date: 16 December 2024
  • Last Date for Application: 15 January 2025
  • Application Fee: Rs. 600/- for General, OBC, EBC; Rs. 400/- for SC, ST, PH
  • Total Vacancies: 740 (650 Non-TSP, 90 TSP)
  • Age Limit: 18 to 40 years

Application Process:

Candidates can apply online through the official RAU website. Further details can be found on RAU's official site.

Educational Qualification:

Candidates should possess a Degree/Diploma in Ayurveda Nursing from a recognized university.
newTitle: RAU Compounder & Nurse Online Form 2024 Announcement

title: Delhi High Court summons SpiceJet CEO, COO over non-payment of $6 million to lessors - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
summary:
Delhi High Court Summons SpiceJet Executives Over $6 Million Payment Issue

Published on: 16 Dec 2024, 11:26 am

The Delhi High Court has summoned the CEO and COO of SpiceJet to appear in court over a non-payment of $6.03 million due to lessors. The court specified that video conferencing was not an option for their appearance.

  • The court directed SpiceJet executives to appear on January 16, 2025.
  • Engine lessors have initiated legal action against SpiceJet for non-payment.
  • SpiceJet defaulted on a prior agreement to pay $4.8 million in installments.
  • The court has ordered SpiceJet to ground three engines and return them to lessors.
"It is made clear that the request of the counsel for Judgement Debtor (SpiceJet) for appearance of the aforesaid officers through Video Conferencing has been specifically denied."

This order emphasizes the seriousness of SpiceJet's financial issues and its obligations to the lessors as it faces multiple legal challenges.
newTitle: Delhi High Court Summons SpiceJet Executives Over $6 Million Payment Issue
